content:
The provided chunk defines vertices and associated color/normal data for the front and back faces of a 3D box within a geometric shape creation function. It specifies vertex positions, surface normals (0,1,0 and 0,-1,0), and color variations using color1, color2, color3 parameters to create distinct visual properties for different cube faces. This is part of a larger codebase that creates and manipulates geometric shapes like boxes and arrows in a 3D environment.

#Front

    boxVertexWriter.addData3f(sX, sY, sZ)
    boxNormalWriter.addData3f(0, 1, 0)
    boxColorWriter.addData4f(color[0], color[1], color[2], color[3])

    boxVertexWriter.addData3f(sX, sY, -sZ)
    boxNormalWriter.addData3f(0, 1, 0)
    boxColorWriter.addData4f(color1[0], color1[1], color1[2], color1[3])

    boxVertexWriter.addData3f(-sX, sY, -sZ)
    boxNormalWriter.addData3f(0, 1, 0)
    boxColorWriter.addData4f(color1[0], color1[1], color1[2], color1[3])

    boxVertexWriter.addData3f(-sX, sY, sZ)
    boxNormalWriter.addData3f(0, 1, 0)
    boxColorWriter.addData4f(color1[0], color1[1], color1[2], color1[3])

    #Back

    boxVertexWriter.addData3f(-sX, -sY, sZ)
    boxNormalWriter.addData3f(0, -1, 0)
    boxColorWriter.addData4f(color2[0], color2[1], color2[2], color2[3])

    boxVertexWriter.addData3f(-sX, -sY, -sZ)
    boxNormalWriter.addData3f(0, -1, 0)
    boxColorWriter.addData4f(color3[0], color3[1], color3[2], color3[3])
